Key Match Events: Boston Celtics lost to Sacramento Kings with a final score of 114-97.
Boston Celtics entered the fourth quarter tied but were outscored significantly in the final frame.
Sacramento Kings shot 61% from the field and 8-11 from deep in the fourth quarter.
Boston Celtics' offensive struggles led to defensive lapses and frustration among players and fans.
Post-Match Reflections: Joe Mazzulla commented on the impact of inefficient offense on defense.
Jayson Tatum reflected on the team's rough month and the need for better defense.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Fans booed the Celtics midway through the fourth quarter as the Kings capped a 21-7 start to the period.
The Celtics have been struggling with offensive and defensive inconsistencies over the past month.
